    • armorToTier

      public static ArmorTier armorToTier(@Nullable org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itemStack)
      Get the armor tier from an item stack.

      If the item stack is null or not a chestplate, it will return ArmorTier.NONE.

      Parameters:
      itemStack - The item stack to get the armor tier from.
      Returns:
      The armor tier of the item stack.

    • armorToTier

      public static ArmorTier armorToTier(org.bukkit.Material mat)

    • tierToChestPlate

      @Nullable public static org.bukkit.Material tierToChestPlate(@Nullable ArmorTier armorTier)
      Converts an armor tier to a chest plate material.
      Parameters:
      armorTier - The armor tier to convert.
      Returns:
      The chest plate material of the armor tier. If the armor tier is ArmorTier.NONE or null, null will be returned.

    • isChestPlate

      public static boolean isChestPlate(@Nullable org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itemStack)

    • isChestPlate

      public static boolean isChestPlate(org.bukkit.Material mat)

    • humanEntityToPlayer

      @Nonnull public static org.bukkit.entity.Player humanEntityToPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)
      Converts a human entity to a player. If the human entity is not a player, it will try to get the player from the UUID of the human entity.

      If the player is not found, an NullPointerException will be thrown.

      Parameters:
      humanEntity - The human entity to convert.
      Returns:
      The player.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the player could not be found.

    • humanEntityToOptionalPlayer

      @Nullable public static org.bukkit.entity.Player humanEntityToOptionalPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)

      public static String nullableColorToString(@Nullable org.bukkit.ChatColor color)

    • toInt

      public static int toInt(String str, int defaultValue)

    • between

      public static int between(int val, int min, int max)
      Ensures that a given value does not exceed the provided upper and lower bounds.
      Parameters:
      val - The value to check.
      min - The lower bound limit.
      max - The upper bound limit.
      Returns:
      The value if it is bigger than min and larger than max, otherwise either min or max.
